page.title: 09TRANSPORT
page.content: {FERRY }In Tarbert there is a vehicular ferry which sails to Uig, in Skye,and Lochmaddy in North Uist.This is to be replaced by a rollon-rolloff ferry in 1986 which requires major alteration to terminals. {BUS}There are about 6 buses in Tarbert at present.They run between Harris and Stornoway each day with a double journey on Friday.They are used to bring pupils to school each day but on Monday and Friday they also take senior pupils to and from Stornoway. {TAXI}There are about 6 taxis in and around the village.Some of them are in use to take pupils to school as well as taking school meals to small primary schools. {AIR}This is only possible through Stornoway Airport. All the roads are tarred;most of them are in good condition.
